decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:	Site Location Plan; 2024/12/BRH/1001 (Existing Floor Plans and Existing Block Plan); 2024/12/BRH/1002 (Existing Elevations); 2024/12/BRH/1003 (Proposed Ground Floor and First Floor Plans for Main Dwelling); 2024/12/BRH/1004 (Proposed Elevations Main Dwelling); 2024/12/BRH/1005 (Proposed Block Plan and Floor Plan and Elevations for Outbuilding Dwelling).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, including the aircraft noise data in Section 6, SPG10 (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (60 dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with best practicable mitigation measures, as necessary, to achieve the criteria for external amenity spaces. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below kitchen/ dining/ living and bathrooms of separate flat and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedroom adjoining the staircase to the upper flat. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to occupation of the development, details of cycle and refuse storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The cycle parking shall include a total of five (5) bicycle spaces: two (2) for each flat in the main property and one (1) for the single storey residential unit at the rear garden. The refuse storage shall be in accordance with Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and retained as such thereafter.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle and refuse storage, in accordance with Policy T5, SI 7 and SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent Order revoking or reenacting that Order), no external alterations or extensions shall be made to the approved single storey residential unit in the rear garden, and no buildings, enclosures, or swimming pools falling under Part 1, Class E of the Order shall be erected within the curtilage of this residential unit, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).
description: Conversion of existing single family dwellinghouse into 2 self-contained flats; single storey side/rear extension; part first floor side extension; part first floor rear extension; construction of a single storey residential unit at the rear garden. (Total 3 new residential units)
